intro: Crassula bibracteata, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rounded rosettes of fleshy, bluish-green leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped white flowers during the summer months, adding ornamental value. It prefers well-draining soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Due to its slow growth and drought tolerance, it is a low-maintenance choice for xeriscaping.
